title: Crisp tikka fish with crushed minty peas

ingredients.item: 1 essential Waitrose Submarine Roll, roughly torn
75g Greek-style yogurt, plus extra to serve
4 frozen essential Waitrose Pollock Fillets, defrosted and patted dry
¼ x 25g pack mint, leaves only, shredded

instructions.step: Put the peas into a pan with 4 tbsp water. Set over a high heat, cover and cook for 5 minutes or until defrosted and tender. Meanwhile, in a processor, whizz the bread with 2 tsp curry paste to make even crumbs. Spread over a plate. On another plate, mix together the yogurt and remaining curry paste.

Dust each fish fillet with flour, coat in the yogurt, then the crumbs. Heat the oil in a non-stick frying pan then cook for 2 minutes on each side, pressing the fish down occasionally with the fish slice as it fries.
Add the mint and a squeeze of lemon to the peas, mash to make a chunky purée, then season. Serve with the fish, a spoonful of yogurt and more lemon for squeezing.
